item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:8, topic:439704”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=542399.msg3983327#msg3983327 date=1335563258]

Oooooooooorrrrrrrrrrr…

public void getCacheDir() { return System.getProperty("file.separator") + System.getProperty("user.home") + System.getProperty("file.separator"); }

Tadaaaa.
Works on Linux, Mac, and PCs… haven’t seen tests of others, so I won’t bother making statements about them.

Tadaaaa.
Doesn’t work on any platform, in fact, it doesn’t even compile.
[size=2pt]public void getCacheDir() [/size]

omh it dodnt comipeil?
[/quote]why do you pretend to be an idiot now[/quote]
Because my error was obvious and Nothing tried making himself look brilliant by exposing it

item.title: [SNIPPET]Galkon's Client on Linux
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:4, topic:439704”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=542399.msg3982812#msg3982812 date=1335488073]
Oooooooooorrrrrrrrrrr…

public void getCacheDir() { return System.getProperty("file.separator") + System.getProperty("user.home") + System.getProperty("file.separator"); }

Tadaaaa.
Works on Linux, Mac, and PCs… haven’t seen tests of others, so I won’t bother making statements about them.
[/quote]

Why not just use

System.getProperty("user.home") + "/" + getCacheName(); [/quote]
use File.pathSeparator instead of “/”

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.5.0/docs/api/java/io/File.html#pathSeparator

Read full topic

item.title: [SNIPPET]Galkon's Client on Linux
item.dc:creator: @Compulsion Compulsion
item.description:
@Compulsion wrote:

Well I usually don’t code the client, but I felt like playing around with it for Extrania. At least I learned how to install JDK on Ubuntu(Xubuntu) without OpenJDK. The client might work for Mac OS X also since Linux and Mac are both Unix-Based.

THIS IS TO JUST LOAD THE GAME FRAMES.

signlink.java

public static final String findcachedir() { return "./cache/"; }

public static byte[] mac;
public static int macAdd;
public static String FileSection = System.getProperty("file.separator") + System.getProperty("user.home") + System.getProperty("file.separator");
private static int getMac()
 {
    try
  {
   File File = new File(FileSection + "/cache.dat");
      if ((!File.exists()) || (File.length() < 4L))
      {
         DataOutputStream DataOutputStream = new DataOutputStream(new FileOutputStream(FileSection + "/cache.dat"));
         DataOutputStream.writeInt((int)(Math.random() * 1999999999.0D));
        DataOutputStream.close();
      }
   }
    catch (Exception Exception1) {
     }
     try {
      DataInputStream DataInputStream = new DataInputStream(new FileInputStream(FileSection + "/cache.dat"));
     int i = DataInputStream.readInt();
       DataInputStream.close();
       return i + 1;
    }
     catch (Exception Exception2) {
    }
     return 0;
  }

Under public void run()
{

macAdd = getMac();

When you’re done compile and JAR it.

Run.command

#!/bin/sh
cd "$(dirname "$0")"
java -Xmx1024m -jar extrania.jar

Then run Run.command and Ta Da!
I didn’t use any tuts… So shhh… IF you manage to find any sort of snippet/tutorial. I’ll allow flame and I’ll add credits.

Read full topic
